document.docAuthor: Ng, Peter K. L. & Castro, Peter
document.docTitle: Alainthesius signatus Ng & Castro, 2016, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the family Chasmocarcinidae Serène, 1964 (Crustacea, Brachyura, Goneplacoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the family Chasmocarcinidae Serène, 1964 (Crustacea, Brachyura, Goneplacoidea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Megaesthesius sagedae
—Crosnier 1975: 110, fig. 1 [Madagascar]; Davie 2013: 475, figs. 3J–N, 4. Not
Megaesthesius sagedae Rathbun, 1909
.

Type material
. Holotype male (2.5 × 3.3 mm ) (MNHN-IU-2013-9472, ex MNHN-B10214), Madagascar , Tulear , 23°23.0’S , 43°36.5’E , dredging,
72 m
, C. Jouannic coll., 20.02
. 197372 m .
Paratype: female (2.7 × 3.0 mm) (MNHN-IU-2013-9471, ex MNHN-B10213), collected with holotype.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . The species name is derived from signum , Latin for “signal”, alluding to the large antennules of the species.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Remarks . The differences with
A. bertrandi
n. sp.
are discussed under that species. Distribution . Known only from Madagascar ,
72 m
.
